Dark was the dawn, and o'er the deep</br>The boist'rous whirlwinds blew;</br>The Sea-bird wheel'd its circling sweep,</br>And all was drear to view,</br>When on the beach that binds the western shore</br>The love-lorn ZELMA stood, list'ning the tempest's roar.

Her eager Eyes beheld the main,</br>While on her DRACO dear</br>She madly call'd, but call'd in vain,</br>No sound could DRACO hear,</br>Save the shrill yelling of the fateful blast,</br>While ev'ry Seaman's heart quick shudder'd as it past.

White were the billows, wide display'd</br>The clouds were black and low;</br>The Bittern shriek'd, a gliding shade</br>Seem'd o'er the waves to go!</br>The livid flash illum'd the clam'rous main,</br>While ZELMA pour'd, unmark'd, her melancholy strain.

"Be still!"  she cries, "loud tempest cease!</br>O!  spare the gallant souls!"</br>The thunder rolls — the winds increase—</br>The Sea like mountains rolls.</br>While from the deck the the storm-worn victims leap,</br>And o'er their struggling limbs the furious billows sweep.

"O!  barb'rous Pow'r!  relentless Fate!</br>Does Heaven's high will decree</br>That some should sleep on beds of state—</br>Some in the roaring Sea?</br>Some nurs'd in splendour deal Oppression's blow,</br>While worth and DRACO pine — in Slavery and woe!

"Yon vessel oft has plough'd the main</br>With human traffic fraught;</br>Its cargo — our dark Sons of pain—</br>For worldly treasure bought!</br>What had they done?  O Nature tell me why</br>Is taunting scorn the lot of thy dark progeny?

"Thou gav'st, in thy caprice, the Soul</br>Peculiarly enshrin'd;</br>Nor from the ebon Casket stole</br>The Jewel of the mind!</br>Then wherefore let the suff'ring Negro's breast</br>Bow to his fellow MAN, in brighter colours drest.

"Is it the dim and glossy hue</br>That marks him for despair?</br>While men with blood their hands embrue,</br>And mock the wretch's pray'r,</br>Shall guiltless Slaves the scourge of tyrants feel,</br>And, e'en before their God!  unheard, unpitied kneel.

"Could the proud rulers of the land</br>Our Sable race behold;</br>Some bow'd by Torture's giant hand,</br>And other's basely sold!</br>Then would they pity Slaves, and cry, with shame,</br>Whate'er their TINTS may be, their SOULS are still the same!

"Why seek to mock the Ethiop's face?</br>Why goad our hapless kind?</br>Can features alienate the race—</br>Is there no kindred mind?</br>Does not the cheek which vaunts the roseate hue</br>Oft blush for crimes that Ethiops never knew?

"Behold!  the angry waves conspire</br>To check the barb'rous toil!</br>While wounded Nature's vengeful ire</br>Roars round this trembling Isle!</br>And hark!  her voice re-echoes in the wind—</br>Man was not form'd by Heav'n to trample on his kind!

"Torn from my mother's aching breast,</br>My Tyrant sought my love—</br>But in the grave shall ZELMA rest,</br>Ere she will faithless prove;</br>No, DRACO! — Thy companion I will be</br>To that celestial realm where Negros shall be free!

"The Tyrant WHITE MAN taught my mind</br>The letter'd page to trace;</br>He taught me in the Soul to find</br>No tint, as in the face:</br>He bade my reason blossom like the tree—</br>But fond affection gave the ripen'd fruits to thee.

"With jealous rage he mark'd my love;</br>He sent thee far away;</br>And prison'd in the plaintain grove</br>Poor ZELMA pass'd the day;</br>But ere the moon rose high above the main</br>ZELMA and Love contriv'd to break the Tyrant's chain.

"Swift, o'er the plain of burning Sand</br>My course I bent to thee;</br>And soon I reach'd the billowy strand</br>Which bounds the stormy Sea.</br>DRACO!  my Love!  Oh yet thy ZELMA'S soul</br>Springs ardently to thee, impatient of controul.

"Again the lightning flashes white</br>The rattling cords among!</br>Now, by the transient vivid light,</br>I mark the frantic throng!</br>Now up the tatter'd shrouds my DRACO flies,</br>While o'er the plunging prow the curling billows rise.

"The topmast falls — three shackled slaves</br>Cling to the Vessel's side!</br>Now lost amid the madd'ning waves—</br>Now on the mast they ride—</br>See!  on the forecastle my DRACO stands,</br>And he now he waves his chain, now clasps his bleeding hands.

"Why, cruel WHITE-MAN!  when away</br>My sable Love was torn,</br>Why did you let poor ZELMA stay,</br>On Afric's sands to mourn?</br>No!  ZELMA is not left, for she will prove</br>In the deep troubled main her fond — her faithful Love!"

The lab'ring Ship was now a wreck,</br>The shrouds were flutt'ring wide;</br>The rudder gone, the lofty deck</br>Was rock'd from side to side—</br>Poor ZELMA'S eyes now dropp'd their last big tear,</br>While from her tawny cheek the blood recoil'd with fear.

Now frantic, on the sands she roam'd,</br>Now shrieking stopp'd to view</br>Where high the liquid mountains foam'd</br>Around the exhausted crew—</br>'Till, from the deck, her DRACO'S well-known form</br>Sprung 'mid the yawning waves, and buffetted the storm.

Long, on the swelling surge sustain'd,</br>Brave DRACO sought the shore,</br>Watch'd the dark Maid, but ne'er complain'd,</br>Then sunk, to gaze no more!</br>Poor ZELMA saw him buried by the wave,</br>And, with her heart's true Love, plung'd in a wat'ry grave.</br>
